channel.title: Times Insider
channel.description: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how news, features and opinion come together at The New York Times.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2016 The New York Times Company

item.title: The World Series Sports Page That Wasn’t
item.description: C’mon, man, these are the Cubs; they’ll surely cooperate, as they have for the past 108 years.
item.author: By WAYNE KAMIDOI

item.title: Tales from the Trails: An Insider Look at the 2016 Presidential Campaign
item.description: From Marco Rubio’s “cute boots” to Donald J. Trump’s taxes, our reporters covered it all. Here’s a look at some of our favorite Times Insider stories from this unprecedented election.
item.author: By INSIDER STAFF

item.title: The Women Who Showed Their Breast Cancer Scars
item.description: It’s never easy to find a patient willing to speak openly about a health issue. In this case, the topic was deeply personal and we needed photos.
item.author: By RONI CARYN RABIN

item.title: 1976 | ‘Metropolitan Diary’ Opens Its Pages
item.description: One of the most popular features among Times readers (if not necessarily among Times Metro editors) started 40 years ago this month.
item.author: By DAVID W. DUNLAP

item.title: Good, Bad and Mad: Andrew Rosenthal on the News
item.description: The Times Opinion columnist Andrew Rosenthal on James Comey, the postelection prognosis and other news. Susan Lehman is the host.
item.author: By SUSAN LEHMAN

item.title: Kid-Wrangling 101
item.description: Their videos poured in. Except for when they didn’t.
item.author: By ANDY NEWMAN

item.title: 19 Countries, 43 States, 327 Cities: Mapping The Times’s Election Coverage
item.description: New York Times political reporters filed some 2.98 million words during the 2016 election. We tracked their stops.
item.author: By ALEXANDER SPANGHER

item.title: A Trek to the Heart of Haiti’s Cholera Epidemic
item.description: A humbling hike through ravaged landscapes brought a Times correspondent to the scene of death and illness.
item.author: By AZAM AHMED

item.title: Times Insider Photo Challenge: Caption This!
item.description: We asked readers — without any context — to caption a photo that ran in The New York Times. Here’s how they responded.
item.author: By INSIDER STAFF

item.title: Meet the Leading Expert on American Political Leaders’ Health, and His ‘West Wing’ Doppelgänger
item.description: “President Bartlet will call on you at a press conference after he discloses he has multiple sclerosis,” my sister Dottie said over the phone in 2001. Huh?
item.author: By LAWRENCE K. ALTMAN, M.D.
